instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is PP3V3_S0SW_LCD? PP3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail necessary to power the image circuitry on the screen. This is necessary to get a picture on the screen. .
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.SMC_LID_RIGHT: What is SMC_LID_RIGHT? SMC_LID_RIGHT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the right LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed – if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_RIGHT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .
definitions.SMC_LID_LEFT: What is SMC_LID_LEFT? SMC_LID_LEFT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the left LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed – if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_LEFT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image on LCD but image on External Monitor OK
threads.message:
Clean board boots fine, I get image on external monitor, tested with 2 known good LCD screens and new LCD flex, no image either. Tested in the Macbook case and just board and test screen, same results.

No shorts on LCD connector

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> Left and Right are both 1.6v
<SIGNAL>PANEL_P5V_EN</SIGNAL> 3.2v * Should this be 5v?
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> 5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<CHIP>U8510</CHIP> pin 1 3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image on LCD but image on External Monitor OK
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PANEL_P5V_EN</SIGNAL> 3.2v * Should this be 5v?"
Why would you expect 5V on enable signal?
Make difference between signals and power rails.

Check levels on pins 1, 2, 4 of <CHIP>U4802</CHIP>.
Also check <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL>, if steady high.
Do you get any voltage at <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image on LCD but image on External Monitor OK
threads.message: It seems to be a backlithg issue, what is the voltage in <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image on LCD but image on External Monitor OK
threads.message:
Thanks for the lesson.

Check levels on pins 1, 2, 4 of <CHIP>U4802</CHIP>:
All are around 0v, I replaced <CHIP>U4802</CHIP> and now they are
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT</SIGNAL> 1.6V
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL> 1.6V
<SIGNAL>IPD_LID_OPEN</SIGNAL> 1.8V

<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> steady 3.2V

<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 0V not shorted and correct diode measurement reading

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image on LCD but image on External Monitor OK
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on all <SIGNAL>DP_INT</SIGNAL> lines of J8500.
Any history about the fault apparition?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image on LCD but image on External Monitor OK
threads.message:
No history available, came from other shop.

Diode mode measurements for <SIGNAL>DP_INT</SIGNAL> lines of J8500.

<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> 0.560
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_AUXCH_C_N</SIGNAL> OL but <RESISTOR>R8503</RESISTOR> is fine
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_AUXCH_C_P</SIGNAL> 0.260
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_ML_C_N</SIGNAL><0> 0.270
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_ML_C_P</SIGNAL><0> 0.270
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_ML_C_N</SIGNAL><1> 0.270
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_ML_C_P</SIGNAL><1> 0.270
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_ML_C_N</SIGNAL><2> 0.270
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_ML_C_P</SIGNAL><2> 0.270
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_ML_C_N</SIGNAL><3> 0.270
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_ML_C_P</SIGNAL><3> 0.270

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image on LCD but image on External Monitor OK
threads.message:
Seems to have broken trace for  <SIGNAL>DP_INT_AUXCH_C_N</SIGNAL>.
The diode mode to ground reading is decided internally into PCH.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image on LCD but image on External Monitor OK
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_AUXCH_C_N</SIGNAL> is OL but <RESISTOR>R8503</RESISTOR> pin 1 and J8500 pin 1do have connection, <RESISTOR>R8503</RESISTOR> pin 2 (<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>) diode reading is on par with another working board measures 0.490 

T2 was already revived but no luck.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image on LCD but image on External Monitor OK
threads.message:
You have broken trace between J8500 and GFX area of CPU.
I said PCH, thinking on old platforms...
